summary: This document is an email chain from September 2022, forwarded within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). It contains an external email from Quincy Johnson making serious allegations about the FBI's role in the Ghislaine Maxwell/Jeffrey Epstein case, linking it to a 2006 school shooting and claiming he has not been compensated for information he provided.

persons.name: Quincy Johnson
persons.context: Writes an email alleging the FBI was involved in criminal acts related to Epstein and Maxwell, references a 2006 school shooting, and claims he has not been compensated for information he shared.

persons.name: Quincy Maurice Johnson

connections.description: Referenced together regarding the criminal acts being investigated by the FBI, as per Quincy Johnson's email.
Johnson alleges the FBI was involved in criminal acts related to Epstein/Maxwell and claims he has investigated their role.

keyFacts: An individual named Quincy Johnson sent an email in September 2022 making serious, unverified allegations that the FBI was involved in the criminal acts of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
Johnson links the Epstein/Maxwell case to a 2006 school shooting at Venice High School, claiming the same 'agents of greed' were responsible.
Johnson claims he provided information that led to action in the Epstein/Maxwell case but has not been compensated, and that his family has suffered as a result.
The email was flagged as 'particularly unsettling' by a US Attorney's Office (USANYS) recipient and forwarded to FBI agents.
The document shows external correspondence being monitored and shared within official law enforcement channels related to the Epstein case years after the main prosecutions.
